lines.text: So you can't sell brushes because nobody understands a word you say?
Yes.
Don't worry, Donald. Don't give up! I have faith in you. Go out and try again.
[she kisses him; Donald is filled with renewed energy]
Whoopee!
[he bounces out of the house, brush case in hand; Daisy watches him leave]
Good luck, darling!
Good-bye, sweetheart!
Good afternoon, sir. Would you be interested in this beautiful brush?
Listen, mac, don't come around here mumblin' like an idiot!
[he grabs Donald by the throat, holds him aloft and kicks him away]
[Donald ingests a voice pill and then tests it out on a mirror reflection]
Well, why don't you...
[his voice deepens and is not just more understandable, but more suave]
...say something?
[Donald jumps back in shock, then smiles]
One, two, three, four, testing. I can talk. I can talk! I can TALK! Oh, boy, I can talk! Hooray, hooray!
[He races down the street]
Daisy, Daisy! I can talk!
[He stops suddenly]
No, wait, I'll surprise her. I've got to sell all my brushes then, be a success and I'll ask Daisy to...
[his deep voice wears off, returning to his normal voice. He quickly ingests another pill and his voice again deepens]
...marry me.
Some people have no respect for a hard-working man.
